alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Boone; Cedar; Madison; Pierce; Stanton; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:59AM CDT until July 12 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FOR MADISON...WAYNE...SOUTHERN PIERCE...SOUTHERN ANTELOPE...EASTERN CEDAR...NORTHERN BOONE AND NORTHWESTERN STANTON COUNTIES... At 459 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Martinsburg to 5 miles northwest of Pilger to 3 miles north of Primrose, moving southeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Madison, Wayne, southern Pierce, southern Antelope, eastern Cedar, northern Boone and northwestern Stanton Counties, including the following locations... Loretto, Willow Creek State Recreation Area, Obert, The Highway 84 and 15 Junction, Brooky Bottom, Camp Assurance and Sholes. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Antelope; Boone; Cedar; Madison; Pierce; Stanton; Wayne
